block.p: Katherine Lindsay Pringle and John Patrick McCormick were married yesterday at the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church in New York. The ceremony was performed by the bride's mother, the Rev. Neta Lindsay Pringle of Wilmington, Del., where she is the senior pastor of the Concord Presbyterian Church.

Ms. Pringle, 31, is keeping her name. She is an associate with Friedman Kaplan & Seiler, a New York law firm. She graduated cum laude from American University and received a law degree cum laude from Georgetown. Her father, Edward G. Pringle of Chapel Hill, N.C., retired as an executive vice president for benefits administration services, in New York, for William M. Mercer, a management consulting firm. He is now an adjunct professor of management at the Kenan-Flagler Business School of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. The bride is a stepdaughter of the Rev. John Potter, a Presbyterian minister, and of Mary Pringle.

Katherine Lindsay Pringle and John Patrick McCormick were married yesterday at the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church in New York. The ceremony was performed by the bride's mother, the Rev. Neta Lindsay Pringle of Wilmington, Del., where she is the senior pastor of the Concord Presbyterian Church.

Ms. Pringle, 31, is keeping her name. She is an associate with Friedman Kaplan & Seiler, a New York law firm. She graduated cum laude from American University and received a law degree cum laude from Georgetown. Her father, Edward G. Pringle of Chapel Hill, N.C., retired as an executive vice president for benefits administration services, in New York, for William M. Mercer, a management consulting firm. He is now an adjunct professor of management at the Kenan-Flagler Business School of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. The bride is a stepdaughter of the Rev. John Potter, a Presbyterian minister, and of Mary Pringle.

Mr. McCormick, 32, is the general counsel and vice president for business development at Norbert Technologies, a data-management software company in Greenwich, Conn. He graduated from Vassar College and received a law degree from Yale. He is a son of Anne McCormick of Butler, N.J., and the late John Patrick McCormick Jr., and a stepson of James Brown. His mother is an administrative secretary with International Specialty Products, a chemical manufacturing company in Wayne, N.J. His father was a lawyer in Yonkers.
